DOC.brief_summary: Background : A topic interest etiology child obesity parental feeding behavior associate child food intake weight status . Objectives : The objective explore directive ( overt ) non-directive ( covert food environmental structure ) type parental feeding control associate child 's food intake weight status . Design : This cross-sectional , exploratory study use structural equation model determine directional association maternal feeding practice child 's food intake weight status . Researchers collect data 330 dyad 3-5yr child mother participate federal preschool program low-income family ( Head Start ) Michigan . Mothers ' feeding practice ( directive non-directive control ) , child 's food intake , height weight mother child measure . Structural equation model test relationship maternal feeding practice , child 's food intake weight status . Hypotheses : 1 . Child weight negatively associate parent ' directive feeding control practice . 2 . Less directive control great non-directive control associate healthy food intake child .
DOC.brief_title: Observational Study Parental Feeding Practices Improve Child 's Food Intake Weight Status
DOC.criteria: Dyads child ( 35yrs ) primary female caregiver Participating Head Start program central Michigan Children disability except speech disorder Caregivers young 18 year old
